Background in Machine Learning systems and software engineering, now specializing in AI systems in production—including deployment readiness, monitoring, latency analysis, and cost-aware infrastructure. Known for solving complex "gray-area" production issues through holistic RCA across application, infrastructure, and network layers.

Improved system reliability and performance by addressing latency, bottlenecks, and misconfigured dependencies in production.

Managed infrastructure built on OpenStack, Rancher, Kubernetes, Zabbix, Grafana, HAProxy, and ELK.
Conducted RCA and implemented monitoring strategies to ensure continuous system availability.
Operated as part of a small SRE team with full production responsibility.

Designed backend components with scalability, observability, and performance in mind.
Gained hands-on experience with event pipelines, logging systems, and operational tooling.
Designed and developed a microservice-based network configuration management system.
Automated network device management using Python and Netmiko.
Implemented CI/CD and containerized deployments with Docker, Kubernetes, and Azure DevOps.
Strengthened expertise in distributed systems, networking, and DevOps culture.
Developed ML-backed APIs for text summarization and intent detection.
Built data collection and preprocessing pipelines.
Co-authored an academic paper on Word Sense Disambiguation, providing a strong theoretical ML foundation.
Experience here informs current focus on operating ML systems reliably in production.
